Class UpdateAppointmentController

java.lang.Object
controller.UpdateAppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class UpdateAppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class creates a controller for UpdateAppointment.fxml.

  • Method Details

    • passAppointmentSelection

      public static void passAppointmentSelection(Appointment selection, int selectedIndex)
      The method for passing the selected appointment from the home screen. The selected appointment object and its index are set to variables in the controller for later use.
      Parameters:
      selection -
      selectedIndex -

    • appointmentOverlapCheck

      public boolean appointmentOverlapCheck(int custId, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, int apptId) throws SQLException
      The method for preventing overlapping appointments. The current Appointment customer ID, start time, end time, and appointment ID are passed into the method. An observable list is populated with appointments from the database. The list is iterated through so the start and end times of the current appointment can be checked against existing appointments not including the current appointment.
      Parameters:
      custId -
      start -
      end -
      apptId -
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onUpdateAppointmentButton

      public void onUpdateAppointmentButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, SQLException
      The event handler method for the update button. This method assigns the text field inputs to variables for use in the Appointment class constructor. The method uses various forms of logic to ensure the texts fields are all filled out and use the correct data types, if not a dialogue box is displayed with the error that needs to be corrected. Selected variables are then passed into update() and then homeScreen() is called. The user is directed back to the home screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException
      SQLException

    • onCancelUpdateAppointmentButton

      public void onCancelUpdateAppointmentButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The event handler method for the Cancel button. homeScreen() is called and the user is directed back to the home screen. No appointment is updated.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • findContactById

      public Contact findContactById(int id) throws SQLException
      The method for finding a Contact by its ID. selectAllContacts() is called to populate an observable list that is iterated through to compare the passed contact ID and return the appropriate Contact.
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:
      The Contact object corresponding to the passed in ID
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • findCustomerById

      public Customer findCustomerById(int id) throws SQLException
      The method for finding a Customer by its ID. selectAllCustomers() is called to populate an observable list that is iterated through to compare the passed customer ID and return the appropriate Customer.
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:
      The Customer object corresponding to the passed in ID
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • findUserById

      public User findUserById(int id) throws SQLException
      The method for finding a User by its ID. selectAllUsers() is called to populate an observable list that is iterated through to compare the passed user ID and return the appropriate User.
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:
      The User object corresponding to the passed in ID
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      The first method called when the UpdateAppointmentController is initialized. The combo boxes and text fields are populated with attributes from the selected appointment. A Try/Catch block is used for any SQLExceptions.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -
